intro: Olotrema collinsii, commonly known as the Collins' milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture.
